Utterance: Hi! It’s nice to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie. I’ve been okay. I did talk to my son about my goals, and it went well.
That’s wonderful! How did that conversation go?
He was really supportive. He even helped me look at some listings together.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re making progress. How do you feel about the listings you looked at?
There are a couple that seem promising, but I’m still nervous about the whole moving process.
It’s completely natural to feel nervous about such a big change. What specifically makes you feel nervous?
I guess it’s the uncertainty. I worry about affording rent and if I’ll like the new place.
Those are valid concerns. Have you thought about creating a budget to help ease your worries?
I haven’t yet, but that sounds like a good idea.
Creating a budget can provide clarity and help you feel more in control. Would you like to set a goal to work on that this week?
Yes, I think I can do that. It would help to see everything laid out.
Great! And how about your job applications? Have you made any progress there?
I updated my resume, and I applied to a couple of jobs. I’m still waiting to hear back.
That’s a great step forward! How did you feel updating your resume?
It felt good to reflect on my experiences, but I still worry if it’s good enough.
It’s common to feel that way. Remember, your resume is just a tool to showcase your skills. You bring a lot of value that can’t be captured on paper.
That’s true. I need to remind myself of that.
Absolutely! And how about our mock interview? Are you ready to give it a try today?
Yes, I think I’m ready. I’m a little nervous, but I want to practice.
That’s completely normal. Let’s start with a common question: “Tell me about yourself.”
Okay, um… I have a background in liberal arts and have been working on my skills in personal assisting. I’m very organized and enjoy helping others.
That’s a great start! You mentioned your experience and strengths. How about adding a personal touch, like a hobby or interest?
Oh, right! I enjoy writing and watching home improvement shows, which helps me think creatively.
Excellent! That adds depth to your response. How do you feel about your answer?
I feel more confident about it now.
That’s great to hear! Let’s try another question. “What are your greatest strengths?”
I’d say my ability to listen and empathize with others, and my organizational skills.
Those are strong strengths, especially for personal assisting roles. Can you give an example of how you’ve used those strengths?
Sure! In my previous volunteer role, I helped organize events and made sure everyone felt included.
That’s a wonderful example! It illustrates your skills well. How do you feel about your interview skills now?
I feel a lot better. Practicing really helps.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, the more you practice, the more comfortable you’ll become. Anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think I’m good for now. I feel more prepared for interviews.
That’s fantastic! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time. Remember to keep me updated on your job applications and housing search.
I will. Thank you for your help, Ellie!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Goodbye!
Goodbye!
